input.description: Search HTAN publications about spatial transcriptomics from 2024

input.description: Check pubs search help for date filtering options

content.content:
usage: htan search [-h] [--keyword KEYWORD] [--author AUTHOR] [--year YEAR]
                   [--max-results MAX_RESULTS] [--format {text,json}]
                   [--timeout TIMEOUT] [--dry-run]

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --keyword, -k KEYWORD
                        Filter by keyword
  --author, -a AUTHOR   Filter by last author
  --year, -y YEAR       Filter by publication year
  --max-results, -n MAX_RESULTS
                        Maximum results (default: 100)
  --format, -f {text,json}
                        Output format
  --timeout TIMEOUT     HTTP timeout (default: 60)
  --dry-run             Show query URL without executing

tool_use_result.stdout:
usage: htan search [-h] [--keyword KEYWORD] [--author AUTHOR] [--year YEAR]
                   [--max-results MAX_RESULTS] [--format {text,json}]
                   [--timeout TIMEOUT] [--dry-run]

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --keyword, -k KEYWORD
                        Filter by keyword
  --author, -a AUTHOR   Filter by last author
  --year, -y YEAR       Filter by publication year
  --max-results, -n MAX_RESULTS
                        Maximum results (default: 100)
  --format, -f {text,json}
                        Output format
  --timeout TIMEOUT     HTTP timeout (default: 60)
  --dry-run             Show query URL without executing

input.command: uv run htan pubs search --keyword "spatial transcriptomics" --year 2024 --max-results 20
input.description: Search HTAN publications about spatial transcriptomics from 2024

content.content:
PMID: 39711562
  Title: Integration of Imaging-based and Sequencing-based Spatial Omics Mapping on the Same Tissue Section via DBiTplus.
  Authors: Enninful A, Zhang Z, Klymyshyn D, Zong H, Bai Z, ... (+11 more)
  Journal: Research square (2024)
  DOI: https://doi.org/10.21203/rs.3.rs-5398491/v1
  Abstract: Spatially mapping the transcriptome and proteome in the same tissue section can significantly advance our understanding of heterogeneous cellular processes and connect cell type to function. Here, we present Deterministic Barcoding in Tissue sequencing plus (DBiTplus), an integrative multi-modality ...

Here, we present Deterministic Barcoding in Tissue sequencing plus (DBiTplus), an integrative multi-modality ...

  Title: Differential chromatin accessibility and transcriptional dynamics define breast cancer subtypes and their lineages.
  Authors: Iglesia MD, Jayasinghe RG, Chen S, Terekhanova NV, Herndon JM, ... (+55 more)
  Journal: Nature cancer (2024)
  DOI: https://doi.org/10.1038/s43018-024-00773-6
  Abstract: Breast cancer (BC) is defined by distinct molecular subtypes with different cells of origin. The transcriptional networks that characterize the subtype-specific tumor-normal lineages are not established. In this work, we applied bulk, single-cell and single-nucleus multi-omic techniques as well as s...

PMID: 39478210
  Title: Tumour evolution and microenvironment interactions in 2D and 3D space.
  Authors: Mo CK, Liu J, Chen S, Storrs E, Targino da Costa ALN, ... (+41 more)
  Journal: Nature (2024)
  DOI: https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-024-08087-4
  Abstract: To study the spatial interactions among cancer and non-cancer cells1, we here examined a cohort of 131 tumour sections from 78 cases across 6 cancer types by Visium spatial transcriptomics (ST). This was combined with 48 matched single-nucleus RNA sequencing samples and 22 matched co-detection by in...

PMID: 39386723
  Title: Multimodal Spatial Profiling Reveals Immune Suppression and Microenvironment Remodeling in Fallopian Tube Precursors to High-Grade Serous Ovarian Carcinoma.
  Authors: Kader T, Lin JR, Hug C, Coy S, Chen YA, ... (+24 more)
  Journal: bioRxiv : the preprint server for biology (2024)
  DOI: https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.09.25.615007
  Abstract: High-Grade Serous Ovarian Cancer (HGSOC) originates from fallopian tube (FT) precursors. However, the molecular changes that occur as precancerous lesions progress to HGSOC are not well understood. To address this, we integrated high-plex imaging and spatial transcriptomics to analyze human tissue s...

PMID: 38106203
  Title: Imputing Single-Cell Protein Abundance in Multiplex Tissue Imaging.
  Authors: Kirchgaessner R, Watson C, Creason A, Keutler K, Goecks J
  Journal: bioRxiv : the preprint server for biology (2024)
  DOI: https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.12.05.570058
  Abstract: Multiplex tissue imaging are a collection of increasingly popular single-cell spatial proteomics and transcriptomics assays for characterizing biological tissues both compositionally and spatially. However, several technical issues limit the utility of multiplex tissue imaging, including the limited...

PMID: 38714197
  Title: Mapping the cellular biogeography of human bone marrow niches using single-cell transcriptomics and proteomic imaging.
  Authors: Bandyopadhyay S, Duffy MP, Ahn KJ, Sussman JH, Pang M, ... (+24 more)
  Journal: Cell (2024)
  DOI: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cell.2024.04.013
  Abstract: Non-hematopoietic cells are essential contributors to hematopoiesis. However, heterogeneity and spatial organization of these cells in human bone marrow remain largely uncharacterized. We used single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) to profile 29,325 non-hematopoietic cells and discovered nine transc...

content.text:
Here are **7 HTAN publications** about spatial transcriptomics from 2024:

1. **DBiTplus** (Enninful et al.) — Integrative method for spatial transcriptome + proteome mapping on the same tissue section. *(Research Square & bioRxiv)*
   - DOI: [10.1101/2024.11.07.622523](https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.11.07.622523)

2. **Breast cancer subtypes and lineages** (Iglesia et al.) — Multi-omic (bulk, single-cell, spatial) analysis of chromatin accessibility and transcriptional dynamics across breast cancer subtypes. *Nature Cancer*
   - DOI: [10.1038/s43018-024-00773-6](https://doi.org/10.1038/s43018-024-00773-6)

3. **Tumour evolution in 2D and 3D space** (Mo et al.) — 131 tumour sections across 6 cancer types profiled by Visium ST, snRNA-seq, and CODEX. *Nature*
   - DOI: [10.1038/s41586-024-08087-4](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-024-08087-4)

4. **Fallopian tube precursors to HGSOC** (Kader et al.) — Integrated high-plex imaging and spatial transcriptomics of ovarian cancer precursors. *bioRxiv*
   - DOI: [10.1101/2024.09.25.615007](https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.09.25.615007)

5. **Imputing protein abundance in multiplex imaging** (Kirchgaessner et al.) — Methods for addressing limited marker panels in spatial proteomics/transcriptomics. *bioRxiv*
   - DOI: [10.1101/2023.12.05.570058](https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.12.05.570058)

6. **Bone marrow niche biogeography** (Bandyopadhyay et al.) — scRNA-seq + proteomic imaging to map non-hematopoietic cell spatial organization in human bone marrow. *Cell*
   - DOI: [10.1016/j.cell.2024.04.013](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cell.2024.04.013)

The standout papers are the *Nature* paper by Mo et al. (large multi-cancer Visium cohort) and the *Cell* paper on bone marrow niches. Would you like me to fetch the full details on any of these?

   - DOI: [10.1101/2024.11.07.622523](https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.11.07.622523)

   - DOI: [10.1038/s43018-024-00773-6](https://doi.org/10.1038/s43018-024-00773-6)

3. **Tumour evolution in 2D and 3D space** (Mo et al.) — 131 tumour sections across 6 cancer types profiled by Visium ST, snRNA-seq, and CODEX. *Nature*
   - DOI: [10.1038/s41586-024-08087-4](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-024-08087-4)

4. **Fallopian tube precursors to HGSOC** (Kader et al.) — Integrated high-plex imaging and spatial transcriptomics of ovarian cancer precursors. *bioRxiv*

5. **Imputing protein abundance in multiplex imaging** (Kirchgaessner et al.) — Methods for addressing limited marker panels in spatial proteomics/transcriptomics. *bioRxiv*
   - DOI: [10.1101/2023.12.05.570058](https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.12.05.570058)

6. **Bone marrow niche biogeography** (Bandyopadhyay et al.) — scRNA-seq + proteomic imaging to map non-hematopoietic cell spatial organization in human bone marrow. *Cell*
   - DOI: [10.1016/j.cell.2024.04.013](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cell.2024.04.013)

The standout papers are the *Nature* paper by Mo et al. (large multi-cancer Visium cohort) and the *Cell* paper on bone marrow niches. Would you like me to fetch the full details on any of these?
